comments.body: Is this true?  Do we use cut-official-release.sh to cut alpha releases?  If so, how does it end up doing different things than are described below under 'Cutting and official release'?
Never mind.  Reading through the script, this now makes sense.
should we make a branch for each point release?

The reason to create a branch is to add code to it. For major/minor releases, there's an expectation that you'll create patch releases, so preemptively creating the release branch is reasonable. You actually don't have to - our tools could retroactively create the release branch.

For patch releases, the assumption is that they're terminal. A patch release should only be a tag. You can imagine creating hotfix branches off of patch releases, but this is a bit of a different conversation and not tied to the normal release process - these are probably tied to specific customers, e.g. 
1.0.1-acme etc. But at this point in the release process, we have nothing that would do that.

(FWIW, I've been trying to stick to the nomenclature of "patch release" for .Z version bumps, because we currently have a version system that is http://semver.org/ compliant.)

Okay, it seemed we were also using branches not just for code but also as part of building and pushing binary releases.  But on looking through build-official-release.sh, it appears we're using tags for those.

And +1 to make-a-release-$FOO-branch as part of the .0 release so that .1 and .2 and .3 are all consistent with the same instructions.

Correct. Part of my goal with `build-official-release.sh` was to make it crystal clear that you're building from a tag, do not pass go, do not do anything else. I explicitly wanted it divorced from any part of your original repo, because of all the gorp associated with branches/yadda yadda.
In fact, if there was just a GitHub API for "grab tarball from tag", I'd probably just use it. There might be.

I know how to do tarball from git shasum....

`https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/archive/5b4dc4edaa14e1ab4e3baa19df0388fa54dab344/kubernetes-5b4dc4e.tar.gz`

https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/tarball/v0.20.0/kubernetes-0.20.0.tar.gz

May also be what we want...

Yeah, the issue with building from the tarballs is that right now, you get this for 'Client Version':

```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"0", Minor:"20.0", GitVersion:"v0.20.0", GitCommit:"", GitTreeState:"not a git tree"}
```

I think the level of hermeticism I introduced in #10687 is sufficient and works with our existing scripts.
